Their spanish mackerel is some of the best I've ever had, and I don't know what it is about their California rolls but I'm not usually a big fan (typically BORING!) but not here. They're incredibly delicious! Make sure to check out the back room, where you can draw on the walls!

I have had better.  I ordered teriyaki chicken and the meat was spongy. The wasabi was so mild that when i poured it on my roll there was absolutely no effect. My roll was too bready. My husband had a beef soup and he found his meat to be spongy as well. We think they brined the meat too long . If they can fix those things maybe we will come back.  Sorry guys, this was very disappointing for $55.00 dollars.  The only thing we liked was the miso.

My favorite west side sushi, love the exotic rolls here mostly.  I cant recall them because I make my wife pick them out.  I do know one is called the "climax"  because I am a guy and of course I am going to remember that.  The service is always good here the atmosphere is pretty nice considering it is in the Fry's shopping center.  I take my wife on dates here so its not too casual if you know what I mean.  I am pretty sure you can satisfy a sushi snob here but I am not one so I dont know for sure.  My wife is and she's happy.....
My husband and I went there after they changed ownership, eeh...Ok.

I feel bad that my review contradicts your overall rating of a 4 star.  This was a very poor experience based on a very recent visit.  We found Fresh Wasabi on Yelp and trusted we would have a nice Japanese meal with a little sushi.  The experience was embarrassing.  We were the only patrons in the place.   One waitress spent more time watching TV and talking to the chef than serving us.  We sat for long periods just watching her and waiting.  She was not helpful with questions about the menu for our first visit.  The food was very disappointing.  No character, no visual appeal, poor flavor profiles. I could not recommend this place and am sorry I trusted this review.  I don't like to review so critically, but it is deserved.  My only positive statement is that it was clean.

Tried this place for the first time yesterday, Happy I did. Reading the Yelp reviews definately helped my decision. Food was very good and fresh. Can't beat the price, Happy Hour from 2-Close M-Sat is nice. The Staff was awesome and very friendly. Nice decor and clean. We got a pretty good size plate of Rolls for about $23.. I will be back soon...

Wanted to like this place, but it was very mediocre.

The happy hour special was priced low but sadly it also tasted low.   Everything tasted off and quality was sub par.  I don't think it too much to expect sushi to be somewhat fresh.  That is what sushi is suppose to be right?

If want a sushi roll for under $5 this is the place to go, I mean its only $5.  However you get what you pay for.

Wow!! I honestly was so impressed with this establishment. The staff was soooo friendly. I could care less if the food is great if the customer service is crap but thank God they already won me over with their kindness. Now the food. It was very good. I went in with zero expectations only because of the location and Ive been let down by "plaza sushi" before but it was quality fish. Honestly it was so good my husband I forgot to take photos after our appetizers. They also have an amazing happy hour. Who has happy hour till close!!!?? SUSHI FIX! To top it all off we only had one item off the happy hour menu but our bill was still extremely forgiving on our wallets for quality sushi. Thanks guys. Will definitely be returning.

Came here while in town on business.    Food was excellent!   Staff was great, Amber, Haley were so helpful with what to order and then Alex crushed it with off the menu sushi creations that were amazing!   Will be back!

The best sushi I have tasted in AZ, and I have tried my fair of sushi here.... a very big selection of sushi rolls, some favorites are climax roll, guilty pleasure and first love, love the screaming fever albacore salad. I have to say sushi in AZ is pricey everywhere so its standard there. 2 people usually runs about $60-$80 .... but its worth it, its delicious and very fresh!!!!

On Bell Road in NW Phoenix/Glendale you will find several places to enjoy sushi.  This place is near the top when you consider quality, value, and overall experience out of all the choices you have to chose from.

Located in a completely renovated strip mall anchored by a Fry's, the place atctually looks nice from the outside and not rundown like so many other unfortunate strip malls littering the valley.  Says something for the area if they feel it is necessary to make it look new and fresh again.

The inside is nice and cozy, very inviting, with soothing music to help you enjoy your sushi/sashimi/or japanese food as you desire.  The quality is fresh and delightful with appropriate portion size as well.  They have great daily specials with bento box choices, sushi, or even teriyaki chicken.

This place is a very good choice for Japanese food for the area.  I haven't tried the teppanyaki with my many visits, but sometime I will.  Maybe an update will be due after such.  Otherwise, I would definitely recommend Fresh Wasabi to anyone.
Went with my family for the first time a couple weeks ago. The sushi was okay but service was great....quick and genuine, happy to serve.

It's few and far between that I ever give a five star review but I can honestly say that you will not find higher quality sushi in the valley.  I've been coming here for nearly a decade, back when Masa (the owner) used to call this joint, Fresh Wasabi.  Since the remodel, he has dubbed the new vibe of the restaurant, The Sushi Fix.  I'm lovin it! 

The service is always on point too.  I only order sashimi so I refuse to go to a sushi restaurant that doesn't meet the highest quality standard for fresh, supreme grade sushi cuts.  There are a ton of great rolls to try out too though.

Excellent food, excellent service, seems to be under different management which may have improved it from before.  Great neighborhood sushi joint with great quality and really trash sashimi!  The white tuna and salmon sashimi were excellent, pairing with the fresh wasabi makes it even better.  My only complaint is that I don't come here more often!

Great happy hour prices. Fast service and friendly staff. Cheater chopsticks available for the chopstick inclined.  I really enjoyed the raw salmon and tuna. The rolls are also very tasty, but I prefer to gorge on the raw fish. It was Delicious.

Groovy Happy Hour specials and innovative rolls are what I remember fondly from Fresh Wasabi. Tuna with mango? Pretty cool. Other rolls covered with flavorful avocado slivers and topped with tempura were pretty nice. I really do appreciate the creativity coming from the chefs, and it totally makes up for the boring, more traditional items that distract you from wise selections from happy hour. 

I had the most tasteless fried squid ever. If memory serves, these squid bits were breaded and not battered, and served with plain ol' Sriracha. 

The crab puffs were just 'meh' also, but this serving is definitely more about quantity and tiding you over until the good stuff is ready.

Additionally, remember to always refuse deep-fried rolls from your waitress. The eel sauce is weak and sparse, and the only fillings I can recall were cream cheese and regret.

As far as drinks, there's a decent sake menu, but seriously, who's gonna shell out for something more expensive than Sho Chiku Bai at a place like this? We just wanna toss it in our Sapporo like bros and call it a day. Protip: Add the "sake bomb" option to your menu (rather than ordering beer and sake separately) like every other sushi bar in your price range. Plum wine was cool though.

So in the end, this is a generic sushi bar whose saving grace is a chef with great creativity using limited ingredients. If you want to gorge yourself on deep fried tempura everything, then go right ahead. But that's not the kind of diner I write for. I write for those who like to enjoy something more unique. And if you browse the menu at Fresh Wasabi, I think there's more than enough to pique your interest.
Great food, great prices.. I would gladly eat here again soon.. Actually i will eat here again soon :-)

Was completely blown away by this establishment. Food, service and ambulance is outstanding. If you're hungry at lunch time, I highly recommend the Bento Box. We where stuffed and had enough to take home. 
We are now regular costumers.

One of my favorite restaurants. Service is not too bad on busy weekends, but it makes up for the excellent food they serve. The owner decided to put two teppanyaki grills and it wasn't a bad decision, at all. If you want to save a little money on the teppanyaki, go during lunch. Sushi (rolls, sashimi, nigiri) are always awesome.

Big Fan of this place.

The sushi rolls are excellent and vary from healthy to heart-attack in nature.  All are delicious.  The service is good.  The wait times are pretty minimal, sushi bar is always open.  Ambience is casual.  This is as good as it gets for west-valley sushi.
I absolutely love this place. The service is great every single time, the food is consistently AMAZING and the happy hour is amazing. You can't beat it. I love this place!!

Not a very good place for sushi or service.  Went there this past weekend due to reviews on yelp, and also some coupons in the mail.

Sushi was just ok, service a bit below par.

Not very fresh for the sushi, and some of the fried items were very heavily battered, and pretty much obliterated the underlying taste.

I got the Seared Salmon Wrap, Booty Booty Roll, Spicy Crab Roll, and a Spicy Tuna Roll. Everything tasted fresh and flavorful. 
The Seared Salmon Wrap has Snow Crab, Avocado, Salmon Sashmi Slices, and thinly sliced green onions as garnish. This comes with five wraps and it a distinctive taste, but it's savory. 
Booty Booty Roll has shrimp tempura, cream cheese, avocado, eel, and spicy tuna. Drizzled with spicy mayo, creamy wasabi sauce, and eel sauce. It tasted absolutely amazing! I would definitely order this again the next time I come by.
The other two rolls; Spicy Crab and Spicy Tuna, are your generic rolls that you can get in any sushi restaurant. 

Overall, the rolls are perfectly sized to accommodate people with small mouths. The rolls also don't fall apart easily, they are well put together to keep all the ingredients inside and mess free while enjoying.

I would recommend this place for the food and the atmosphere it brings. It's perfect for hang outs and dates.

We got our plate of sushi and noticed that it had a Philly roll instead of a sweet thing and our waitress Jamie said "no worries!" And immediately fixed it! She was great, super nice, and didn't hesitate to fix our order. The sushi was good, nothing too impressive, but I was still happy with what I ordered. The renovations look amazing by the way! Beautiful interior.
Wow! Amazing sushi tonight. It's really hard finding sushi dining with cucumber wrapped rolls and those are my fav. Kudos on having a baby changing station in the bathrooms :)

Went to this place with my husband for the first time yesterday. It was recommended to us by a friend.  I had seen this hidden treasure before, but never been in to the store.  Food was great, and the portion sizes were GREAT.  Prices were good for Happy hour prices, staff was very friendly, and if you need something changed, the staff were only too happy to accomodate this.  There was no Childrens menu, but when asked, the staff said they would be happy to make smaller portions for children.  All in all, we will be going back again.

This place rocks. Doesn't look like much from the outside, but the food was top notch and the service was as good as one could hope for. Thank you, Iris!

The Climax and the Avalanche rolls were like eating dessert and the Viva Las Vegas Roll was as good as advertised. Maybe better.

I live in Boston, my buddy is from Vegas, and my brother in L.A. and we agree this place was exceptional.

I haven't had such fresh sashimi in a long time. We had the Sashimi for two. The fresh wasabi was awesome.  The jalapeno poppers were a crunchy tempura batter with just enough spice, drizzled with eel sauce. Yum!!! Great prices at happy hour. We'll be back!
Great happy hour even on Saturday till 6 and again after 8.  Friendly service and fresh high quality sashimi and fun rolls.  Try the climax!
Outstanding sushi and the staff is amazing! Highly recommend it! Go try them!! Great sushi and customer service.

This place was really good. Variety of sushi and rolls. Happy hour from 2 pm to close. Who can beat that? Tried their tootsie roll and crunchy roll. Delicious. And their staff were so nice and friendly.

Hands down, this is my favorite sushi spot.  I used to be an avid Ah-So visitor...USED to be.  I now know what amazing sushi tastes like thanks to Fresh Wasabi.  Each roll I've tried is delicious and filling.  If you go during happy hour, you can easily fill 2 bellies for $20-$30.  Try the spicy crab roll...you will not regret it.

First timer, never again. Our waiter speak no English whatsoever. She kept nodding yes to everything I said. I told her I was a vegetarian so no meat, only vegetables substitution,  And the only thing she repeated back was no meat! 
My appetizer came, all that was in my sushi was avocado and cream cheese.....  yeah. Smh.
Also, i ordered the udon vegetable. I noticed it was taking a very long time to come out. So I ask the waiter, she said ten minutes....  fifteen minutes passed by, I ask another waiter about my entree, she said the vegetable udon was never ordered. 

I had to get up several times for napkins, wasabi, hot water and the bill..

So there you have it!

The lunch specials here at this place are fantastic!  $8.99 or $9.99 for a bento lunch, with about 5-7 pieces of delicious sushi, tuna or california rolls, tempura, soup, salad, and edamame.   This is one of the best deals for lunch anywhere!!  The quality of the sushi is usually fantastic to boot.  This is one of my favorite lunch spots.

Fresh Wasabi is a haven to those who cherish quality. The cuts are perfect, the rolls are deliciously complex, the presentation is beautiful, and the service is prompt and non-intrusive.

Also, don't forget why they named this place what they did: be sure to try their fresh wasabi, it's amazing!
Best sushi on the west side! Love it and eat there 3-4 times per week! Fresh and great quality...order the First Love Roll!

Really good sushi and lots of options. Happy menu is well sized and is from 2pm to close. Nice atmosphere. Hit the place up on a Thursday eve and wasn't busy at all. Las Vegas and Tootsie roll are good.

Wow who would of thought it would be so hard to find good sushi in the valley.  Even the places I tried in Scottsdale were lame and uninspired.   I had the Monkey Brains (spicy tuna stuffed tempura friend mushrooms) which are always my favorite when I can find them at Sushi places.  I also ordered the 8 piece sashimi sampler and was pleased with its freshness and variety.  I also ordered the Climax Roll and the Sushi for the Soul Roll.  Needless to say I ended up bringing some home but it kept well and it made a great sack after a night out.

Bf and I were around this area because we wanted to check out the outlet. We were craving sushi and found this place on yelp.
We were greeted by the host when we first came in and sat us at a table right away. 
An asian lady named Iris, she gave us the menu and welcomed us. 
I told her I checked in on yelp, I wanted to get the free miso. She responded, "of course how many would you like?" I told her two. We ordered the calamari for appetizer. Came with sriracha sauce and eel sauce. It was different, it was pretty good. With some lemon added to squeeze for the calamari. It was nice and soft. Not rubbery like some calamari. 
We ordered vegas, tootsie, tuna, and shrimp rolls. It was yummy! I loved how Iris kept checking on us.. She made sure we were okay and made sure the food came out right and how its supposed to. 
At the end we had some left overs. We told her we would take it to go. She was so nice that she made sure we had ginger, soy sauce, and wasabi to go! I also mentioned to her I appreciated everything she had done for us because the service was great. I told her we live in Chandler area. She says "wow that is so far, would you like me to pack your food with some ice to make sure it is fresh?" She was so thoughtful, and I loved that. She thanked us for giving their restaurant a try. The next time we are around here. We are definitely coming back. Great food and great service!

I have eatin here 4 different times now. Twice before they expanded and twice after. They have the freshes fish around. Nigiri and Sashimi blows me away along with their other crazy rolls they have. I have not been to any other sushi place in AZ that has so many different rolls to choose from. Big fan of the rolls with jalapeno slivers and siracha ontop of them. Enjoy this place anyday of the week but make sure you pair whatever you get with sake and ichiban!!!!!!!!

I want to give them a quick shout-out because we really do enjoy this little place. Our server yesterday was laid back but a pro and he gave us a mini-Japanese lesson and couple of laughs. It is notable - the difference that good service can make. 

Their Happy Hour (HH) is probably one of the best we've tried - given the price point and the variety of selection. Not only that - the regular menu prices are below what you'd pay many other places and the food is just as good if not even better due to the creativity of the chefs. 

We really enjoyed the Ono nigiri - it's so fresh, buttery and delicious. The rolls we had this time were the classic rainbow ($8) currently on HH and the Climax. ($12 never HH) and both are worth an "order again."

They have the laminated, spiral-bound type of menu here (with photos and descriptions) which makes ordering that much more enjoyable. They have the usual other offerings of udons, full range of appetizers, etc. 

Their strip mall location is the reason that this place falls off my radar, but I'm making the effort to write 'em up because I want to remember to visit more often. I don't want to be saying "Ono! I forgot."
Went on a sister date there and ordered off of the happy hour menu, every piece tasted fresh and I loved the flavors. The waitress was nice and I'd defiantly go back again!

I have been coming to Fresh Wasabi for YEARS! Their sushi is always so fresh and delicious. The service is always fast to seat and eat. It's never too busy in there so it's a great small place for a quiet date. The lion king roll is my favorite. Definitely don't judge this place by it's cover. It's very small but the food is divine!

Been going for years, some of the best sushi in town. Try the spicy tuna, climax roll, and first love, the Las Vegas and the amigo are awesome as well. The one in surprise is nothing like this location. I tried it and the sushi sucked. Go to this location instead. Nice affordable prices during happy hour and friendly staff. Small little quaint place but the sushi makes it worth it!

We've been here three or four times and its probably going to continue to be a regular in our sushi restaurants. The Happy Hour is great as everyone has mentioned and we indulge ourselves with several rolls. Every time we've gone the fish has tasted fresh and the rest of the ingredients have been well balanced. Of course we only eat the simpler rolls nothing deep fried or overly stuffed with cream cheese or it overpowers the rest of the flavors. Good service every time we've been there, we've always had the same waitress and she's been attentive and funny.

I have been looking for a new place for sushi ever since my beloved Kampai changed ownership and fell from grace.  My brother and I made the mistake of watching Jiro Dreams of Sushi and knew we had to find an AUTHENTIC Japanese sushi bar to satisfy cravings the movie evoked.  

After several hours of online research, we decided to try Fresh Wasabi at 6645 W Bell not to be confused with the location in Surprise which is not owned by Masa Kim.  Tucked away in a little strip center next to Fry's we found a little piece of heaven. 

We did Omakase and OMG it was amazing!  We had hamachi, halibut fin, albacore, uni, squid, hawaiian tuna, hamachi kama and more.  Everything was authentic, fresh, and absolutely delicious.  To our delight it was happy hour (daily from 2-6pm) so we enjoyed large beers for only $4.  Masa Kim advised us of his plans to remodel this location in the near future and also told us he recently opened Sushi Style in Moon Valley which we will be trying next...maybe even tonight.  It was that good.

Boyfriend took me here and said the fresh wasabi was the best 
He didn't lie 
Great wait staff and excellent sushi

A great sushi place! We've been here 3-4 times and just keep wanting to go back. The staff is great, relaxed and professional, and the fish is fresh and tasty. Our favorites are the jalapeno poppers (fresh take on a classic appetizer) and the salmon sashimi (the touch of lemon really elevates it), and the rolls are delicious as well - shout-out to the Las Vegas roll!  The happy hour menu is pretty good - 10-15 dishes for reduced prices for most of the night - can't remember the specifics but I remember being like "Woah, wait, how long is happy hour?"
The service was excellent and the sushi was even better, this place has an amazing Las Vegas Roll, I will definitely be eating here again.

It is usuakly my favorite place but today i chsnged my mind.....  They told my Mother in law she couldnt have her siezure service dog on the chair .  
Bad form....

Wife out of town. She does not eat sushi, so I thought this would be a good week to go out and enjoy. I know very little about sushi, just that I like to eat sushi. Went on Yelp and looked for a well review place near my house. I chose a place but when I got there the sign on the door said NOT on MONDAY. What to do. Pick a well reviewed place near to where I was. Fresh Wasabi was less than a mile away. 
Decor? I guess typical of most I have been to. Clean friendly people. I was seated as soon as I got there as the place was not super busy. There were about 5 or 6 tables with people enjoying their meal. 
I always have trouble ordering. I am learning but still need help. I asked my waitress what she suggested. I told her I wanted a verity. She suggested a combination of a tuna roll and about 8 other pieces of different kings of sushi. This ended up to be a great suggestion as I really enjoyed the meal. Way to much for one person to eat. (I did eat it all.) I was stuffed. Meal was served with soup and a salad. Both were excellent. My waitress was very attentive and kept my glass full of tea. 
For being friendly, helpful. good food, nice quite relaxing meal? This was the best place I have visited (Lets say Arizona). If I want sushi on Monday this is the place.
